How to Install mm3d on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • mm3d

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install mm3d on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing mm3d on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall mm3d in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install mm3d, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install mm3d Using apt

To install mm3d in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install mm3d using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install mm3d

The installation of mm3d might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install mm3d Using apt-get

To install mm3d using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install mm3d.

sudo apt-get -y install mm3d

Install mm3d Using Synaptic

To install mm3d using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install mm3d on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for mm3d. This will display the mm3d package in the package window, now to install mm3d, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the mm3d package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of mm3d.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install mm3d Using aptitude

To install mm3d on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of mm3d.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install mm3d using the command aptitude install mm3d.

sudo aptitude -y install mm3d

How to Upgrade mm3d on debian

If you want to upgrade the mm3d package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade mm3d using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade mm3d to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade mm3d.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade mm3d sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade mm3d

Upgrade mm3d using Aptitude

To upgrade mm3d using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade mm3d.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade mm3d

Upgrade mm3d using Synaptic

To upgrade mm3d using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for mm3d, now right-click mm3d, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade mm3d just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall mm3d on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall mm3d from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just mm3d, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove mm3d

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of mm3d

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of mm3d you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge mm3d

Remove mm3d using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall mm3d using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for mm3d, right-click the mm3d package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall mm3d click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install mm3d on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade mm3d using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of mm3d then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
